content:
• Tuesday, December 11, 2012
  • KITD

    The NASDAQ has halted trading in KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -8.6%), pending the receipt of requested...

    The NASDAQ has halted trading in KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -8.6%), pending the receipt of requested information. KIT shares fell to a mere $0.63 today following news of a delisting warning and the departure of two directors.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:46 PM
  • RTEC

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RTEC +8%. DLB +6%. MCBC +4%. OTC:BGMD +4%. GEO...

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: RTEC +8%. DLB +6%. MCBC +4%. OTC:BGMD +4%. GEO +3%.
    After-hours top losers: GEOS -12%. CIE -10%. EXAR -7%. NTSP -7%. ALXA -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • WMB

    Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) agrees to acquire a 50% interest in Access GP and ~25% of limited...

    Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) agrees to acquire a 50% interest in Access GP and ~25% of limited partner units of Access Midstream Partners (NYSE:ACMP) for ~$2.4B. The deal, together with ACMP's planned acquisition of Chesapeake's remaining midstream assets, expands WMB's presence in 10 major shale and unconventional producing areas. WMB also announces a 46.5M-share public offering of common stock. WMB -2.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA +4.4%), which rallied today along with other Chinese ADRs, has formed a partnership...

    Sina (SINA +4.4%), which rallied today along with other Chinese ADRs, has formed a partnership with Chinese mapping leader AutoNavi (AMAP +4.5%). In a buzzword-filed PR, the companies state Sina Weibo content will be accessible via AutoNavi's mobile apps, and that Weibo users will gain access to AutoNavi's mapping and location services. Weibo now has over 424M registered accounts, though monthly active users are closer to 40M.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:41 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Conspicuously absent from Mark Smith's resignation announcement was any mention of the SEC...

    Conspicuously absent from Mark Smith's resignation announcement was any mention of the SEC investigation over the accuracy of Molycorp's (MCP) disclosures. The take from 24/7's Jon Ogg: "To announce that a CEO has left the company with no explanation in the midst of a regulatory investigation is not in good taste at all. It could even be alarming." MCP -5.3% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 9 Comments
  • CMI

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) authorizes an additional repurchase of up to $1B in common stock. The program...

    Cummins (NYSE:CMI) authorizes an additional repurchase of up to $1B in common stock. The program was approved as the company approaches completion of its current $1B share repurchase program approved by the Board in February 2011. The buyback is part of a larger program by CMI to return value to shareholders, and follows a 25% increase in the dividend announced back in July. Shares +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM
  • CIE

    Cobalt Energy (NYSE:CIE) -7.1% AH after announcing a public offering of $1.2B of convertible...

    Cobalt Energy (NYSE:CIE) -7.1% AH after announcing a public offering of $1.2B of convertible senior notes due 2019. CIE says it intends to use net proceeds to fund its capital expenditures and for general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP) says CEO Mark Smith has resigned; no explanation is offered. Board vice chairman...

    Molycorp (MCP) says CEO Mark Smith has resigned; no explanation is offered. Board vice chairman Constantine Karayannopoulos is named interim president and chief executive. Shares -6.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 12 Comments
  • DWDP

    DuPont (DD) +2.5% AH after announcing a $1B share buyback and issuing in-line guidance for FY...

    DuPont (DD) +2.5% AH after announcing a $1B share buyback and issuing in-line guidance for FY 2012. DD expects FY 2013 EPS growing low- to mid-single digits (consensus +11.8%) with sales growing in the low-single digits (consensus +2.3%); all segments are seen delivering solid Y/Y earnings growth except for a substantial drop in Performance Chemicals.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Molycorp (MCP +5.8%) posts its second straight strong gain, as the picture grows brighter: Large...

    Molycorp (MCP +5.8%) posts its second straight strong gain, as the picture grows brighter: Large stockpiles of rare earths are finally starting to dwindle, and top competitor Lynas is undergoing regulatory problems with Malaysia's government. How much higher can MCP climb? Oracle's Laurence Balter has a $50 price target, but shares still would be shy of their 2011 summer high near $7.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM | 4 Comments
  • GNW

    In the wake of hiring a new CEO, Genworth's (GNW +2.8%) price target range is lifted to $6-$9...

    In the wake of hiring a new CEO, Genworth's (GNW +2.8%) price target range is lifted to $6-$9 from $4-$8 by Wells' John Hall. Hall believes 2013 could see the long-awaited IPO of Genworth's Australian mortgage insurance business, the sale of the remainder of its Canadian operation, a return to profitability in the U.S., and debt reduction along with a share buyback. A tall order for Tom McInerney.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • CDMO

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -2.4%) says it's received a letter from Nasdaq notifying the...

    Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM -2.4%) says it's received a letter from Nasdaq notifying the company that it's regained full compliance with the minimum bid price continued listing requirement. As of December 10, the company evidenced a closing bid price of its common stock in excess of the $1.00 minimum requirement for at least ten consecutive trading days, and the issue is now closed.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM
  • JEC

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC +0.5%) says it's landed a contract with a maximum value of $20M from the...

    Jacobs Engineering (JEC +0.5%) says it's landed a contract with a maximum value of $20M from the San Francisco Bay Area Rapid Transit to provide on-call construction management services supporting the agency's Capital Improvement Program and delivery of design-bid-build, design-build and procurement projects.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • AEGN

    Aegion (AEGN +1.2%) moves up after its Hong Kong subsidiary, Fyfe Hong Kong Ltd., lands a...

    Aegion (AEGN +1.2%) moves up after its Hong Kong subsidiary, Fyfe Hong Kong Ltd., lands a contract valued at $8.5M for the rehabilitation of potable water pipelines for the Government of Hong Kong Water Supplies Department.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • CTRP

    As high-beta tech names trade higher today, several Chinese ADRs pummeled recently on...

    As high-beta tech names trade higher today, several Chinese ADRs pummeled recently on SEC/delisting fears are among the standouts. CTRP +5.9%. YY +4.9%. YOKU +7.2%. SPRD +5.3%. SINA +5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • DRTX

    Durata Therapeutics (DRTX +2.4%) says its Phase III study of dalbavancin, which is under...

    Durata Therapeutics (DRTX +2.4%) says its Phase III study of dalbavancin, which is under investigation for the treatment of acute bacterial skin infections, achieved its primary endpoint within 48-72 hours after initiation of therapy. The company added that the key secondary endpoints achieved were also supportive of the primary endpoint.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • CPRX

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical Partners (CPRX -2.4%) says it's issued 6,666,667 shares of its...

    Catalyst Pharmaceutical Partners (CPRX -2.4%) says it's issued 6,666,667 shares of its authorized but unissued common stock to BioMarin Pharmaceutical (BMRN +2.5%) upon the automatic conversion of a $5M loan that CPRX received from BMRN in October in connection with it's licensing of the North American rights to Firdapse. The shares were issued at a conversion price of $0.75 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +3.2%) trades up today after its board approves a 2-for-1 split that will...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +3.2%) trades up today after its board approves a 2-for-1 split that will take effect early next year. The split, which is set for January 7, will increase the number of shares outstanding to roughly 1.52B from about 759.3M. The drug maker's shares have surged this year amid investor expectations for its new four-in-one HIV treatment Stribild, and the potential for its investigational hepatitis C drugs.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • NTGR

    NetGear (NTGR +6.7%) has rallied after Wi-Fi equipment peers Ruckus Wireless and Aruba Networks...

    NetGear (NTGR +6.7%) has rallied after Wi-Fi equipment peers Ruckus Wireless and Aruba Networks each received multiple coverage launches. The fact many of the launch reports touched on healthy enterprise Wi-Fi demand could be stoking interest in NetGear, which trades at lower multiples (but is also growing slower). 10.5% of NetGear's float was shorted as of Nov. 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:56 PM
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN +3.8%) is up after providing a guidance update that's being received...

    Texas Instruments (TXN +3.8%) is up after providing a guidance update that's being received favorably in light of industry and company-specific issues. During its update call, TI noted the wireless processor/connectivity business it's exiting will post a Q4 loss on revenue of ~$200M, and that those sales should be gone by 2014. Computing, industrial, and telecom infrastructure chip demand is also weak, though console and e-reader demand is healthy - that last bit could be a positive for AMZN and BKS. Chip stocks are outperforming (SOXX +2%). (Audi deal)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • BGMD

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:BGMD +146%. SOMX +75%. OTC:ACUR +56%. TNS +43%. ULBI +18%. MEAD +16%....

    Midday top 10 gainers: OTC:BGMD +146%. SOMX +75%. OTC:ACUR +56%. TNS +43%. ULBI +18%. MEAD +16%. ESYS +15%. SZYM +14%. GTXI +13%. CLWR +12%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: CBMX -11%. ESIO -11%. AMCN -9%. SEV -9%. GGAL -8%. SPW -8%. OTCQB:TELK -7%. JW-A -7%. MGLN -7%. SXC -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • ENLK

    Crosstex Energy LP (XTEX +0.4%) estimates 2013 adjusted EBITDA at $220M-$250M and distributable...

    Crosstex Energy LP (XTEX +0.4%) estimates 2013 adjusted EBITDA at $220M-$250M and distributable cash flow of $130M-$160M, sufficient to support distributions of $1.36-$1.46 per unit. Also, XTEX and Crosstex Energy Inc. (XTXI +5.2%) say they are proceeding with phase II of their Cajun-Sibon natural gas liquids pipeline extension in Louisiana.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • TVTY

    Healthways (HWAY -5.6%) slips after Citigroup initiated the shares today with a Sell and a $9...

    Healthways (HWAY -5.6%) slips after Citigroup initiated the shares today with a Sell and a $9 price target, saying that expectations for any margin improvement at the health-care provider are too high. Citi notes that contract losses, lower margins on new business, and less favorable rates on renewed contracts will wind up disappointing the Street consensus, and leave limited upside.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM
  • ISIL

    Intersil (ISIL +7.3%) is sharply higher after JPMorgan argues the recent resignation of CEO...

    Intersil (ISIL +7.3%) is sharply higher after JPMorgan argues the recent resignation of CEO David Bell "could be a good development" if it leads the analog chipmaker to lower its cost structure - Intersil announced a restructuring in May that led to the elimination of 11% of its workforce. JPM is still reiterating an Underweight, citing Intersil's share losses in a weak PC market and the possibility its high payout ratio will force a dividend cut (current yield is 6.3%).

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM
  • ANDE

    The Andersons (ANDE +2.8%) finalizes its purchase of a majority of the grain and agronomy...

    The Andersons (ANDE +2.8%) finalizes its purchase of a majority of the grain and agronomy locations of Green Plains Grain Company, a subsidiary of Green Plains Renewable Energy (NASDAQ:GPRE). The purchase includes seven facilities with a combined grain storage capacity of about 32M bushels. This will increase the storage capacity of the company's Grain Group by nearly 30%. In addition, two Iowa locations also have 30,000 tons of combined fertilizer storage.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • S

    Sprint (S -1%) and Clearwire (CLWR +13.1%) are "moving closer" to a deal in which the former...

    Sprint (S -1%) and Clearwire (CLWR +13.1%) are "moving closer" to a deal in which the former would buy the 49% of the latter it doesn't own, sources tell David Faber. He adds Sprint has been talking with Clearwire shareholders about buying their stakes for ~$3/share, and that a deal could be announced by year's end. Clearwire has spiked to $2.72, while MetroPCS (PCS -1%) has ticked lower. PCS was clocked last week after Reuters reported Sprint is unlikely to make a bid before its SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) deal closes. Update: The WSJ backs up Faber's report.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • ARUN

    While Ruckus Wireless is lower following a slew of coverage launches, rival Aruba Networks (ARUN...

    While Ruckus Wireless is lower following a slew of coverage launches, rival Aruba Networks (ARUN +2.9%) is rallying after getting started at Outperform by Oppenheimer, and at Neutral by JPMorgan. Oppenheimer touts ramping enterprise Wi-Fi adoption (partly due to the BYOD trend); Aruba's exposure to the fast-growing SMB space; and the "potentially transforming" impact of its ClearPass software for managing  wireless and wired network access. JPM is also positive on ClearPass, but is concerned about competition and a high P/E.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +5.5%) says that follow-up findings from an ongoing Phase II study suggest...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +5.5%) says that follow-up findings from an ongoing Phase II study suggest that its investigational oral agent ibrutinib resulted in "high and durable responses" and was generally well toleratedin patients with relapsed or refractory mantle cell lymphoma.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM
  • RKUS

    After rising 50% from Nov. 28 to yesterday's close, Ruckus Wireless (RKUS -5%) is slumping on...

    After rising 50% from Nov. 28 to yesterday's close, Ruckus Wireless (RKUS -5%) is slumping on underwriter coverage day - the carrier/enterprise Wi-Fi equipment firm has received 4 bullish and 2 neutral ratings. Needham, among the bulls, highlights the 63% CAGR the carrier Wi-Fi market is expected to show from 2011 to 2015 - that's also a positive for Ericsson's (NASDAQ:ERIC) BelAir Networks unit. Goldman, starting at Neutral, is concerned about valuation. Lazard started Ruckus with a Buy yesterday.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM
  • SDT

    Sandridge Mississippian Trust (SDT +1.4%) moves higher as Anthony Donato lays out how a brutal...

    Sandridge Mississippian Trust (SDT +1.4%) moves higher as Anthony Donato lays out how a brutal year for the shares has left them undervalued under nearly any oil and gas price scenario. One trader agrees, saying brokers - burned by VOC, WHX, and WHZ - have been dumping anything that looks similar. This includes not just SDT, but SDR and ECT as well.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • ASTC

    Astrotech (ASTC +4.7%) returns to earth after posting an early gain of more than 20% out the...

    Astrotech (ASTC +4.7%) returns to earth after posting an early gain of more than 20% out the gate, following the company's announcement that its subsidiary, Astrotech Space Operations, has won a Not-to-Exceed $16M task order contract for commercial payload processing services at Vandenberg Air Force Base in California. Under the contract, the company will compete for future missions NASA is planning for launch from Vandenberg through December, 2017.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +2.8%) trades up after reporting that final Phase II data demonstrated...

    Aeterna Zentaris (AEZS +2.8%) trades up after reporting that final Phase II data demonstrated that its oral AKT inhibitor perifosine, when combined with sorafenib, was well tolerated by heavily pretreated lymphoma patients. Furthermore, promising clinical response activity was observed in patients with classical Hodgkin Lymphoma, suggesting that this subgroup could represent a target population for future studies.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +3.1%) has bounced to $546 with the help of positive analyst commentary. While...

    Apple (AAPL +3.1%) has bounced to $546 with the help of positive analyst commentary. While Morgan Stanley talks up potential iTV interest, JPMorgan is raising its forecast for Q4 AT&T (NYSE:T) iPhone activations to 8M from 7M. Also, ISI's Brian Marshall is expecting a strong Chinese iPhone 5 launch - China Unicom (NYSE:CHU) just announced its pre-orders have topped 300K. (Apple Monitor)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 21 Comments
  • SN

    Sanchez Energy (SN +2%) provides an interim update of its Eagle Ford shale production and...

    Sanchez Energy (SN +2%) provides an interim update of its Eagle Ford shale production and operations, estimating its current net production rate at ~4,400 boe/day, of which ~84% was oil, up 159% Q/Q. SN says it is running two rigs in the Palmetto area, one rig in Maverick and two rigs in Marquis; it expects to spud up to five wells by year-end 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • HOG

    Shares of Harley-Davidson (HOG +1.6%) strike higher with rumors out that the company hired a...

    Shares of Harley-Davidson (HOG +1.6%) strike higher with rumors out that the company hired a strategic advisor to search for ways to unlock value. On the fundamental front, December sales will be in focus with European rivals stepping up their marketing campaigns in the U.S., while Harley-Davidson rolls out special-edition models in front of the holiday shopping season.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:52 AM
  • OCLR

    Volatile Oclaro (OCLR +12.3%) is higher after announcing: 1) It has received preliminary court...

    Volatile Oclaro (OCLR +12.3%) is higher after announcing: 1) It has received preliminary court approval for the settlement of 4 class-action suits related to the Opnext merger. 2) Priced its $25M offering of 2018 convertible notes. The notes yield 7.5% and carry a conversion price of $1.846/share - following today's move, Oclaro trades at $1.60.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • CORV

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME +41%) leaps higher out of an earlier trading halt after the company says...

    Cardiome Pharma (CRME +41%) leaps higher out of an earlier trading halt after the company says it's reached a deal with Merck (MRK +0.6%) to settle its debt obligations stemming from it's collaboration on vernakalant - a treatment for atrial fibrillation - which it signed in April 2009. Under the terms of the settlement, CRME will pay MRK $20M to settle its outstanding debt of $50M, and MRK will terminate a $100M credit facility it had made available to CRME.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (BAC +0.8%) receives constructive comments from JPMorgan, which says to expect a...

    Bank of America (BAC +0.8%) receives constructive comments from JPMorgan, which says to expect a number of upside earnings estimate revisions. The bank, says JPM, is best positioned for a housing recovery and higher dividends and buybacks. Also filling the sails will be cost cuts and a growing loan book.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM | 5 Comments
  • PLG

    Shares of Platinum Group Metals (PLG -14.2%) plunge on news the miner is offering shares to...

    Shares of Platinum Group Metals (PLG -14.2%) plunge on news the miner is offering shares to raise ~C$180M, intending to use the proceeds for purposes including developing its WBJV Project 1 platinum mine and exploration and engineering at the Waterberg project.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • BGMD

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +78%) nearly doubles in value today after the company says it's...

    BG Medicine (OTC:BGMD +78%) nearly doubles in value today after the company says it's CardioSCORE test has been awarded a CE Mark enabling it for commercial sale in the EU and other countries that recognize the CE Mark. The CardioSCORE is a patented diagnostic blood test designed to improve risk prediction of major cardiovascular events. The test isn't yet available in the U.S., however the company is currently in discussions with the FDA to obtain 510(k) clearance.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM
  • GDOT

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +2.8%) push higher after Piper Jaffray comes out with a note...

    Shares of Green Dot (GDOT +2.8%) push higher after Piper Jaffray comes out with a note indicating the company is doing well in the face of new competition from American Express' new debit card. In a survey of Wal-Mart stores, only 15% reported a significant loss of debit card market share for Green Dot.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • KITD

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -7.2%) is down to $0.65 after disclosing it has received a NASDAQ...

    KIT Digital (OTC:KITD -7.2%) is down to $0.65 after disclosing it has received a NASDAQ de-listing warning, and that directors Wayne Walker and Barak Bar-Cohen have resigned. Bar-Cohen's short-lived tenure as CEO ended in August. KIT, which is running low on cash, says it's still "exploring a broad range of strategic alternatives."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • GPS

    Shares of Gap (GPS +2.8%) turn around their losing streak after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage...

    Shares of Gap (GPS +2.8%) turn around their losing streak after Goldman Sachs initiates coverage with a Buy rating. The stock could be getting a little support from Rebook chain store sales data for last week that came in just a tad over expectations even with consumers "procrastinating" over purchases.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:16 AM
  • TRIP

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +7.7%) has rallied to $41.35 on news Liberty Interactive (LINTA +0.1%)...

    TripAdvisor (TRIP +7.7%) has rallied to $41.35 on news Liberty Interactive (LINTA +0.1%) acquired voting control by purchasing 4.8M shares at $62.50. LINTA now controls 57% of TRIP's voting rights, though only 22% of its equity. Orbitz (OWW +3%) and Travelzoo (TZOO +3.3%) are joining Expedia in rising in sympathy.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • HTZ

    Hertz Global (HTZ -3.6%) trades lower after a group of investors dump 50M shares. The sale was...

    Hertz Global (HTZ -3.6%) trades lower after a group of investors dump 50M shares. The sale was an allotment of stock held by investment funds associated with Clayton, Dubilier & Rice. (8-K)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • LLEN

    L&L Energy (LLEN +4.1%) reports FQ2 EPS of $0.21 on ~$55M in revenues. Net income...

    L&L Energy (LLEN +4.1%) reports FQ2 EPS of $0.21 on ~$55M in revenues. Net income attributable to LLEN increased 104% Y/Y to $7.7M. Coal mining production rose 93% Y/Y to 185K tons from 96K in the year-ago quarter and up 24% from 149K tons in Q1.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • JCP

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +4.3%) get a lift with positive comments out from Oppenheimer and...

    Shares of J.C. Penney (JCP +4.3%) get a lift with positive comments out from Oppenheimer and reports saying customer traffic was strong last weekend. An exec with the retailer noted in-season markdowns on coats and jackets were due to an unseasonably warm November that slowed sales of the items. It's the kind of grounded comment Wall Street has been looking for after the dreamy rhetoric of Ron Johnson over the last year has worn thin.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • MAIN

    MAIN Street Capital slides 4.6% to $27.95 after pricing a 2.5M share secondary at $28/share. The...

    MAIN Street Capital slides 4.6% to $27.95 after pricing a 2.5M share secondary at $28/share. The immediate use of the proceeds will be to pay down credit lines until new investments can be found. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:30 AM | 1 Comment

  • Market preview: European and U.S. equities are having an up day so far ahead of the FOMC's...

    Market preview: European and U.S. equities are having an up day so far ahead of the FOMC's meeting today and tomorrow, when it may ramp up the money printing machines. The S&P benchmark is +0.3%. Optimism over the latest dispatches from the fiscal cliff saga is helping the mood. Later: Wholesale Trade
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • QRTEA

    Liberty Interactive (LINTA) acquires voting control of TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) by buying over...

    Liberty Interactive (LINTA) acquires voting control of TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) by buying over 4.799M shares from Barry Diller and The Diller-von Furstenberg Family Foundation at $62.50 a share. TRIP halted, but PCLN +0.9% and EXPE +3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:14 AM | 2 Comments
  • SOMX

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SOMX) +103.4% premarket after agreeing to be acquired by Pernix...

    Somaxon Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SOMX) +103.4% premarket after agreeing to be acquired by Pernix Therapeutics (NYSEMKT:PTX) in a stock-for-stock transaction valued at $25M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • SOMX

    Premarket gainers: SOMX +101%. TNS +45%. VE +6%. CLDX +5%. URBN +5%.Losers: ESIO -19%.

    Premarket gainers: SOMX +101%. TNS +45%. VE +6%. CLDX +5%. URBN +5%.
    Losers: ESIO -19%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • GNW

    Genworth (NYSE:GNW) finds a permanent CEO, with former Aetna and ING executive Thomas McInerney...

    Genworth (NYSE:GNW) finds a permanent CEO, with former Aetna and ING executive Thomas McInerney tapped to fill the position. James Riepe will continue to serve as non-executive chairman of the board. The Street likes: Shares +3.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • KMP

    Kinder Morgan Partners (NYSE:KMP) -2.4% premarket after its $380M sale of the Express-Platte...

    Kinder Morgan Partners (NYSE:KMP) -2.4% premarket after its $380M sale of the Express-Platte pipeline system to Spectra Energy (NYSE:SE). "There’s a whiff of desperation about this deal," 24/7's Paul Ausick writes. "The sale seems to be an admission that Kinder Morgan needs cash and this is an attractive property that it can easily convert into cash."

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM | 10 Comments
  • DAL

    Shares of Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) trade 1.6% higher premarket following the announcement of...

    Shares of Delta Air Lines (NYSE:DAL) trade 1.6% higher premarket following the announcement of the carrier's strategic alliance with Virgin Atlantic Airways. Industry watchers say the deal is a minor blip on the radar while they wait for the real game changer to come down the pipe, the still-percolating US Airways-American merger.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:53 AM
  • SBGL

    Stillwater Mining (SWC) +3.9% premarket after the stock is selected to join the S&P SmallCap...

    Stillwater Mining (SWC) +3.9% premarket after the stock is selected to join the S&P SmallCap 600 index, effective Dec. 13.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:43 AM
  • MNST

    Stifel Nicolaus upgrades Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) to a Buy rating after reviewing FDA...

    Stifel Nicolaus upgrades Monster Beverage (NASDAQ:MNST) to a Buy rating after reviewing FDA incident reports.     A consortium led by Siris Capital Group agrees to acquire TNS (NYSE:TNS), a provider of data communications and interoperability technology, in a deal valued at $862M including debt. Siris is offering $21/share in cash, representing a 44% premium over TNS's closing price of $14.56 yesterday. TNS may solicit acquisition proposals from third parties for a 30-day "go-shop" period. TNS +44% to $21.02 premarket. (PR)
